intro: Rubus timbal-lagravei microgene radulicaulis, commonly known as the Timbal-Lagravei raspberry, is a rare shrub native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and bracteate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as mountain forests or rocky slopes. Its leaves are trifoliate, with serrated margins, and its fruits are small, red berries that ripen in late summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
